messages.message: The heat in Nagoya seems to get worse every year. It's hard to imagine how it was 50 years ago.
Yeah, I wonder if the temperature patterns have really changed that much.
It would be interesting to see if summers are getting hotter or winters milder.
I've noticed there are fewer birds in the city park. I wonder if it's linked to air pollution.
That's possible. Air quality has been a big issue lately.
Do you think there's any data showing changes in air pollution levels near the park?
I read that some districts have much better air quality than others. Is that true here?
It could be. It depends on factors like traffic and green spaces.
Seeing a map comparing air quality by district would really help.
Flooding seems to happen more often downtown. I wonder if it's due to urbanization.
Possibly. Downtown areas tend to have worse drainage systems too.
I wonder if there's data on rainfall patterns and flooding incidents over the years.
The city has planted a lot of trees recently. I wonder if it's improving the air quality.
That's a good question. Green initiatives usually help with pollution levels.
It would be great to see if there's any noticeable change in the air quality trend.
